Class SudokuApplet

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Panel
              java.applet.Applet
                  javax.swing.JApplet
                      SudokuApplet
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer
public class SudokuApplet
extends javax.swing.JApplet
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener

The SudokuApplet displays a Sudoku grid which has it's initial cell content given by a parameter ("puzzle"). It also allows a user to complete the puzzle and submit their email and solution.

Author:
Ole Sandbu
See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

init

public void init()
Initialise the content of the Applet.

Overrides:
init in class java.applet.Applet

getCellContent

public java.lang.String getCellContent()
Returns the content of the cells as an String of 81 characters containing numbers 0-9. 0 means that nothing has been entered into the corresponding cell while a number between 1 and 9 means that that number has been entered.

Returns:
The content of the Sudoku grid.

getGrid

public char[][] getGrid(java.lang.String gridContent)
Convert a 81 character String to a 9x9 character array.

Parameters:
gridContent -
Returns:
A 9x9 character array.

setCellContent

public void setCellContent(java.lang.String gridContent)
Set the content of the cells using a given String of 81 numbers corresponding to each of the cells.

Parameters:
gridContent - The cell content.

actionPerformed

public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt)
Implements ActionListener.actionPerformed(ActionEvent). Makes the send button send the solution to the server.

Specified by:
actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

reportIncomplete

public void reportIncomplete()
Make a popup appear reporting that the puzzle needs to be completed before it can be submitted.
